Tampa, FL Metro > Clearwater > Restaurants > Lenny's Restaurant Lenny's Restaurant (727) 799-0402 21220 US Hwy 19 N , Clearwater , FL | Directions 33765 27.971001 -82.730100 View Website Menu Share Save Own this Business? Tips for Lenny's Restaurant Recommends AnnaElisabeth Joined 10 months ago 5.0 September 15, 2011 Lenny's Restaurant. Great food, atmosphere, and service. 0 Heart Recommends PPHS84 Joined 2 years ago 5.0 September 23, 2010 BEST. I love Lenny's food !! Amazing relish tray with HOME MADE pickles!!! The best food in the Clearwater area. My entire family are regulars there! I wish I lived in Florida still so I could enjoy the food more regularly!!!! … View More View Less 0 Heart Doesn't Recommend 10Reviews Joined 2 years ago 2.0 June 07, 2010 eat and leave. I have been going to lenny's since i lived in florida in 1990 Always experience the rush from the staff to get in and get out......and thats fine as I go there with that intention. Its not the place to go when you want to enjoy and relax.
Today the waitress was so rushed that when she got the order wrong she blamed me (I was ready to simply eat the food to make the waitress happy......however I just dont eat ham). The food she brought back was cold and .... :( not good at all. I was so disappointed. I could have opened a can of spagettios and had the same level of food.....bad unless your starving. … View More View Less 0 Heart Recommends waternwind Joined 3 years ago 5.0 November 23, 2009 5stars well deserved. It has all been said - Great Food - Good Service - Reasonable prices. I only wish they were open at 2 am for breakfast on the weekends. 0 Heart Recommends LargoLaurie Joined 4 years ago 5.0 July 01, 2008 Philly/South Jersey memories and great food!. WARNING: Lenny's may be habit-forming!
Great food at very good prices, served by a friendly staff in a place with personality... First, deciding what you're going to order is a challenge. The breakfast menu is extensive and intriguing, and as the servers walk by with hot high-piled plates for other diners, your eyes and nose will have you changing your mind a dozen times.
Second, you'll each too much. You'll start out with a danish basket, what many hotels and busy business people might call a"continental breakfast."HA! At Lenny's this is just the"Welcome, we're glad you're here"intro to what's yet to come... the appetizer that helps keep you from chewing on the menu while decided what to order. As hungry as you go in there, you may still find yourself taking leftovers home after eating heartily.
Third, you'll become addicted. Whether a northeast transplant like me who enjoys a gastronomical trip down memory lane or someone who just likes a huge delicious breakfast served the way you want it, you'll go back again and again. Who else in the Tampa area knows how to serve up that scary Pennsylvania/South Jersey mystery meat scrapple extra crispy? Heck, what other area restaurant has even heard of scrapple? You'll make Lenny's a weekend family tradition. When a friend you haven't seen for a while suggests meeting somewhere for breakfast, you'll immediately think"Lenny's."When you have family in town visiting, you'll consider Lenny's a must-do on their itinerary.
Lenny's can be pretty darn slammed, especially on weekends. Parking can be a challenge, and you'll probably have a wait. If you're not in a hurry, it's well worth the wait. Taking the family or a group of friends to this hometown favorite is an outing... an event... not just a place to grab food. If you're going to complain about the wait, head to a nearby fast food restaurant instead. It ain't the Ritz, but it's a heck of a lot more fun and filling! … View More View Less 0 Heart See more tips for Lenny's Restaurant Write a Tip for Lenny's Restaurant Sign in to Write a Tip Write a Tip... optional
